result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronesha T Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

forwarded to Judge McAdams

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court will consider motion for expungement upon  successful completion of probation and full payment of restitution and costs.

Defendant Ronesha T Anderson in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Crime Victim Impact Statement filed by State. 
As to Counts 1 and 2:  Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties. 
As to Counts 1 and 2:  Court ordered SENTENCE WITHHELD and placed the defendant on probation for  18 months with the following conditions:
-  Pay restitution in the amount of $4,135.92 to Walmart, during term of probation, or civil judgment.
-  Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation, or civil judgment.  

Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of probation and full payment of restitution and costs.

Defendant Ronesha T Anderson in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court vacates stayed bench warrant.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant failing to appear.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Oral No Contact Order with Any Wal-Mart Stores.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ronesha T Anderson in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to  Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Ronesha T Anderson
Current: 7722 W Congress #4, Milwaukee, WI 53202   (Effective: 07-09-2015)
Prior: 3050A North 45th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53202
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 07-09-2015 at 01:30pm
